verses.roman:
so 'dhikṣipto durvācobhiḥ
padāhata ivoragaḥ
niścakrāma gadā-pāṇir
amarṣāt tāmra-locanaḥ

synonyms: saḥ—he, Śambara; adhikṣiptaḥ—insulted; durvācobhiḥ—by harsh words; padā—by a foot; āhataḥ—struck; iva—like; uragaḥ—a snake; niścakrāma—came out; gadā—a club; pāṇiḥ—in his hand; amarṣāt—out of intolerant anger; tāmra—copper-red; locanaḥ—whose eyes.
translation: Offended by these harsh words, Śambara became as agitated as a kicked snake. He came out, club in hand, his eyes red with rage.
